# ElectricHVACLoadEvent.Session.State

**Enumeration**

The state of the session.

## Declaration

```swift
enum State
```

## Overview

When a device transitions from from idle to consuming electricity, it must create a load event with [doc://com.apple.energykit/documentation/EnergyKit/ElectricHVACLoadEvent/Session-swift.struct/State-swift.enum/begin]. As it reports events, it sends load events with [doc://com.apple.energykit/documentation/EnergyKit/ElectricHVACLoadEvent/Session-swift.struct/State-swift.enum/active]. Once idle, it closes the session with [doc://com.apple.energykit/documentation/EnergyKit/ElectricHVACLoadEvent/Session-swift.struct/State-swift.enum/end].

## Setting session states

- **ElectricHVACLoadEvent.Session.State.active**: A state that represents all electricity consumption events with active states.
- **ElectricHVACLoadEvent.Session.State.begin**: A state that represents the start of the session.
- **ElectricHVACLoadEvent.Session.State.end**: The end of the session when a load device goes to idle, that is, power/stage returns to zero indicating the load device is no longer consuming or generating electricity A state that represents the end of the session.

## Getting the session information

- **id**: The unique identifier for the session.
- **state**: The state of the session.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
